page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN MADDERTY
page.content: There are no unemployed in this area. Nearly all the men work on farms.There are a lot of jobs on the farms,like driving tractors,cattlemen,shepherds, looking after pigs and chickens. Large farms let out their shooting rights and gamekeepers are employed to rear pheasants and keep vermin down.One man is a rabbit-catcher.There is an agricultural engineer who repairs farm machinery.A few men work as gardeners. The ladies have to travel to Crieff or Perth. They work in shops, offices, hotels, hospitals or nursing homes. A few men travel to work. There is seasonal work for potato-pickers.
